action.action-desc: Mr. Finstad (for himself, Mr. Stauber, and Mrs. Fischbach) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to conduct an audit of fraud relating to waivers of certain requirements of the child nutrition programs during the COVID–19 pandemic, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Feeding Children Not Fraudsters Act of 2023.

section.header: Fraud relating to COVID–19 nutrition waivers

subsection.header: Audit of known fraud relating to COVID–19 nutrition programs and waivers

paragraph.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, and on an annual basis thereafter, the Secretary of Agriculture shall conduct, with respect to the covered period, an audit of a covered State agency relating to known fraud, including such fraud carried out under—

subparagraph.text: the Child and Adult Care Food Program under section 17 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1766);
the Summer Food Service Program for Children under section 13 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1761); and
child nutrition COVID–19 waivers (including with respect to the programs described in subparagraphs (A) and (B)).

paragraph.text: An audit conducted by the Secretary pursuant to this section may only relate to known fraud not examined under any preceding audit conducted by the Secretary pursuant to this section, as applicable.
The audit of a covered State agency conducted pursuant to this subsection shall examine—

subparagraph.text: oversight measures (or lack thereof) by such State agency;
decisions made by such State agency after being made aware of fraud committed by a local agency, institution, or service institution served by such State agency;
hearings conducted by such State agency after being made aware of such fraud;

clause.text: a local agency served by such State agency; and
to the extent practicable, and as applicable, the institutions and service institutions served by such agency;

subparagraph.text: overpayments or improper payments by a local agency, institution, or service institution served by such State agency;
fraudulent uses of funds by a local agency, institution, or service institution served by such State agency; and

clause.text: an institution with respect to the eligibility of such institution to carry out the Child and Adult Care Food Program under section 17 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1766); or

a service institution with respect to the eligibility of such institution to carry out the Summer Food Service Program for Children under section 13 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1761).

paragraph.text: In order to participate in or operate any child nutrition program for the school year or summer period, as applicable, that is the first school year or summer period beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act, a State agency being audited (and any local agency, institution, or service institution served by such State agency) shall fully cooperate with any audit conducted pursuant to this subsection, including by providing any information requested under paragraph (3).
The Secretary of Agriculture shall submit the findings of the audit required under this subsection to—

subparagraph.text: the House Committee on Education and the Workforce;
the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability;
the Senate Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry; and
the Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

paragraph.text: The authority of the Secretary to conduct an audit under this section shall terminate on the date that is 5 years after the date on which the first audit is conducted pursuant to this section.

subsection.header: Requirement To retain records relating to fraud

paragraph.header: Child and adult care food program
paragraph.text: Section 17(f)(1)(B) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1766(f)(1)(B)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: The State shall retain any records related to the fraud, abuse, or invalid claims described in clause (i).

paragraph.text: Section 13(o) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1761(o)) is amended by adding at the end the following:
The State shall retain any records related to any act made unlawful under this subsection.
The Secretary shall retain any records related to any fraudulent act carried out pursuant to a chid nutrition COVID–19 waiver.

The term child nutrition COVID–19 waivers means the nationwide waivers and additional flexibilities published on the website of the Food and Nutrition Service of the Department of Agriculture on July 12, 2022.

The term child nutrition program means a program carried out under the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1751 et seq.) or the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (42 U.S.C. 1771 et seq.).
The term covered period means the period—

The term covered State agency means a State agency serving a local agency, institution, or service institution administering or operating a child nutrition program under which known fraud was committed.
The term institution has the meaning given such term in section 17(a)(2) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1766(a)(2)).
The term known fraud means, with respect to a child nutrition program, fraud for which any person is investigated, charged, or convicted by—
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Agriculture.
The term service institution has the meaning given such term in section 13(a)(1) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1761(a)(1)).
